ContentClassification.TableReference: Office of the Australian Government Actuary, “Australian Life Tables 1990-92”, Australia Government Publishing Services (Canberra, 1995). Accessed: February, 2014 from http://www.aga.gov.au/publications/life_tables_2005-07/downloads/females_alltables_qx.xls.
ContentClassification.TableDescription: Australian Life Tables 1990-92 Female. Minimum Age: 0. Maximum Age: 100
ContentClassification.Comments: Study Data: Based on the census of 30 June 1991, deaths in the three years 1990, 1991 and 1992. Number of births from 1986 to 1992. For ages less than 3, monthly death data used while for ages less than 1 year further details on deaths used. Methodology: Exposed-to-risk and crude central rates of mortality calculated from information obtained from Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS). Special handling for juvenile ages; formula only available upon request. Crude rates then graduated using a combination of manual graduation and fitted cubic splines. Graduated rates for the very old ages constructed by extrapolation. Though evident in overseas studies of mortality for some time, the 1990-92 tables mark the first time a crossover of male and female rates, that is, male rates dropping below female rates at advanced ages, is incorporated. NOTE: The original published tables extend to ages beyond 100. However, with the release of the 1995-97 Australian Life Tables, electronic versions of all preceding tables was made available and, for consistency of presentation, the electronic version truncates all tables at age 100. The truncated electronic version is endorsed by the Australian Bureau of Statistics and Australian Government Actuary hence this table contains the truncated version. Data Transcription Errors: None. Data Certified: 02/2014

MetaData.TableDescription: Australian Life Tables 1990-92 Female. Minimum Age: 0. Maximum Age: 100
